name: Sunday Brunch: Slow-Cooked Scrambled Eggs with Goat Cheese
description: This recipe, adapted from Ina Garten's Barefoot Contessa Family Style, is creaminess squared. The slow-cooked scrambled eggs are by themselves unbelievably creamy, and when you throw in the slightly tangy fresh goat cheese, the entire affair becomes one forkful after...
recipeIngredient: 16 extra-large eggs taken out of the fridge at least a half-hour before using
6 ounces fresh goat cheese (I like Coach), crumbled

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk the eggs in a bowl with the milk, salt, and pepper. Heat 2 tablespoons of butter in a large saute or omelet pan. Add the eggs and cook them over medium-low heat, stirring constantly, until the desired doneness.
Take the pan off the heat and add the goat cheese, chives, and the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter. Stir and allow the eggs to sit for 30 seconds, until the cheese begins to melt. Serve hot.
